results.title: Could metformin be therapeutically useful in Huntington's disease?
results.text_hl: Emerging evidence suggest that dimethylbiguanide (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@), a first-line drug for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@, could be neuroprotective in a range of @<m>DISEASE_Fractures_Spontaneous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005598 @@@brain pathologies@@@, which include @DISEASE_Neurodegenerative_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D019636 @@@neurodegenerative diseases@@@ and @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@brain injury@@@.

results.title: Necrostatin-1 Mitigates Cognitive Dysfunction in Prediabetic Rats With No Alteration in Insulin Sensitivity.
results.text_hl: However, the comparative effects of nec-1 and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on cognition and @<m>DISEASE_Fractures_Spontaneous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005598 @@@brain pathologies@@@ in @DISEASE_Prediabetic_State @DISEASE_MESH:D011236 @@@prediabetes@@@ have not been investigated.

results.title: L6H21 protects against cognitive impairment and brain pathologies via toll-like receptor 4-myeloid differentiation factor 2 signalling in prediabetic rats.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION AND IMPLICATIONS: In @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, L6H21 and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ restored cognition and attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Fractures_Spontaneous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005598 @@@brain pathologies@@@ dose and time-dependently.

results.title: Activation of autophagy attenuates motor deficits and extends lifespan in a C. elegans model of ALS.
results.text_hl: Accordingly, overexpression of @GENE_LGG_1 @GENE_174050 @@@lgg-1@@@ or @GENE_DAF_16 @GENE_172981 @@@daf-16@@@ attenuated the aging and @<m>DISEASE_Fractures_Spontaneous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005598 @@@pathological abnormalities@@@ of mutant @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @GENE_SOD1 @GENE_6647 @@@SOD1@@@ worms, while genetic deletion of @GENE_LGG_1 @GENE_174050 @@@lgg-1@@@ or @GENE_DAF_16 @GENE_172981 @@@daf-16@@@ abolished the beneficial effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

results.text_hl: Despite spirulina, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ had a considerable effect on @<m>DISEASE_Fractures_Spontaneous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005598 @@@pathological@@@ lesions and decreased the level of @CHEMICAL_Malondialdehyde @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008315 @@@MDA@@@.

results.title: Modulatory effect of metformin on cardiotoxicity induced by doxorubicin via the MAPK and AMPK pathways.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ improved the abnormal indexes, serum markers of @DISEASE_Heart_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D006335 @@@cardiac heart injury@@@, echocardiography, electrocardiogram, cardiac @<m>DISEASE_Fractures_Spontaneous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005598 @@@pathology@@@, cardiomyocyte apoptosis, and oxidative stress markers induced by @CHEMICAL_Doxorubicin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004317 @@@DOX@@@.

results.title: Neuroprotective potential of antihyperglycemic drug metformin in streptozocin-induced rat model of sporadic Alzheimer's disease.
results.text_hl: These data indicate the promise of further research of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in early @<m>DISEASE_Fractures_Spontaneous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005598 @@@brain pathologies@@@ to stop neurodegenerative before severe @DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive decline@@@ occurs.

results.title: Combined Administration of Pravastatin and Metformin Attenuates Acute Radiation-Induced Intestinal Injury in Mouse and Minipig Models
results.text_hl: Furthermore, in minipig models, combined treatment with @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@PS@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@ ameliorates gross @<m>DISEASE_Fractures_Spontaneous</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005598 @@@pathological damage@@@ in abdominal organs and attenuated @DISEASE_Radiation_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D011832 @@@radiation@@@-induced intestinal @DISEASE_Neoplasms_by_Histologic_Type @DISEASE_MESH:D009370 @@@histological damage@@@.
